critique: This document is an executive order from 1934 that adjusts the compensation of government employees based on the cost of living. It cites the authority vested in the president by the Act to Maintain the Credit of the United States Government. It is difficult to assess the ideological tilt without more context, but the action itself seems pragmatic. There is no mention of immigration, executive power, federalism, national security, or social inclusion. The document does address economic regulation by adjusting compensation based on the cost of living.
